response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age", "medium", "Being 18 is associated with higher risk due to youth-related behavioral trends."),
    ("Race", "low", "Asian/Pacific Islander background does not statistically exhibit higher recidivism risks relative to other groups."),
    ("Criminal History", "medium", "Five arrests, even without convictions, suggest exposure to delinquent behavior and potential future offenses."),
    ("Employment", "high", "No job during the year is a strong indicator of economic instability, which is closely linked to recidivism."),
    ("Education", "medium", "While a high school diploma is positive, the lack of further education (non-college enrollment) limits opportunities and is a moderate risk factor."),
    ("Substance Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use in the last four years can contribute to recidivism risk, though it is less severe than harder drugs."),
    ("Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone may imply limited social support, which can elevate risk moderately."),
    ("Urban Residence", "medium", "Residing in an urban area is linked to higher exposure to crime and recidivism risk."),
    ("Religious Beliefs", "medium", "Expressing that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes may reflect lower levels of community or moral support, contributing a moderate risk factor.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being 18 is associated with higher risk due to youth-related behavioral trends.
Asian/Pacific Islander background does not statistically exhibit higher recidivism risks relative to other groups.
Five arrests, even without convictions, suggest exposure to delinquent behavior and potential future offenses.
No job during the year is a strong indicator of economic instability, which is closely linked to recidivism.
While a high school diploma is positive, the lack of further education (non-college enrollment) limits opportunities and is a moderate risk factor.
Past marijuana use in the last four years can contribute to recidivism risk, though it is less severe than harder drugs.
Living alone may imply limited social support, which can elevate risk moderately.
Residing in an urban area is linked to higher exposure to crime and recidivism risk.
Expressing that God has nothing to do with personal outcomes may reflect lower levels of community or moral support, contributing a moderate risk factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Asian / Pacific Islander. He has been arrested 5 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological dad in a household of size 2, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
